title: the Courts Act, 1971 (No. 36 of 1971) and section 29 of the Courts Service Act,
heading: 2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I. No. 5
text_raw:
2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I. No. 5 

of 1961), is hereby amended by - 

the substitution at reference number 257 for the matter in columns (4) and (5) of 
the following: 

“Gorey – 

First, Second, Third and Fourth 
Wednesday in each month. First, 
Second and Third Thursday in each 
month. 

All sittings at 10.30 a.m. 

The area comprising the Electoral 
Divisions of (a) the District Electoral 
Divisions of 

Ardamine, Ballindaggan 

Ballybeg, Ballycanew Ballycarney, 
Ballyellis, Ballygarrett, Ballyhoge, 
Ballyhuskard, Ballylarkin, 
Ballymore, Ballynestragh, 
Ballyoughter, Bolaboy, Bree, 
Cahore, Castleboro, Castledockrell, 
Clonroche, Coolgreany, Courtown, 
Ford, Edermine, Enniscorthy Rural, 
Enniscorthy Urban, Ferns, Gorey 
Rural, Gorey Urban, Huntingtown, 
Kilbora, Kilcomb, Kilcormick, 
Kilgorman, Killann, Killenagh, 
Killincooly, Kilnahue, , Killoughrum 
Kilmallock, Kilrush, Kiltealy, 
Limerick, Marshalstown, 
Monamolin, Monaseed, Moyacomb, 
Newtownbarry, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 19th March, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [97] 3 

Rossard, Rossminoge, St. Mary's, 
The Harrow, The Leap, Tinnacross, 
Tombrack, Wells and Wingfield in 
the county of Wexford”

title: the Courts Act, 1971 (No. 36 of 1971) and section 29 of the Courts Service Act,
heading: 4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not
text_raw:
4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not 
completed before the commencement of this Order shall be continued and 
completed as if this Order had been in force at the time at which such business 
had been initiated. 

GIVEN under the seal of the Courts Service, 

22 February, 2024. 

PAUL KELLY, 

Member of the Board of the Courts Service authorised to 
sign documents under the Seal of the Courts Service. 

DEIRDRE DOYLE, 

Officer of the Courts Service designated for the purpose of 
authenticating the Seal of the Courts Service, pursuant to 
section 10 of the Courts Service Act 1998. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [97] 5

title: the Courts Act, 1971 (No. 36 of 1971) and section 29 of the Courts Service Act,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order provides for: 

(a) The amalgamation of the Electoral Divisions of the District 
Court Area of Enniscorthy into the District Court Areas of 
Gorey and Carlow. 

(b) The variation of sittings in Gorey. 

 
 
 
 
 6 [97]
